46:18 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
46:59 Caption: It wasn't the most inspiring 45 minutes that you'll see this week. Let's hope that the second period will be more exciting. The game is quite balanced. The home side display their usual fluent passing, while the visitors use their organization to stop the build up and launch counter-attacks.

44:52 Caption: Mauro Icardi (Inter) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the left post.
46:04 Caption: Nigel De Jong (AC Milan) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the top left corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Samir Handanovic, who keeps it out.
46:37 Caption: Marco van Ginkel (AC Milan) races towards goal but the defender gets back well to make a challenge. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to AC Milan.
47:05 Caption: Giacomo Bonaventura (AC Milan) lifts the ball into the box from the corner, but one of the defending players gets there first to head it clear.
47:38 Caption: Xherdan Shaqiri (Inter) sends a teasing cross into the area, but Diego Lopez intercepts the ball.
48:48 Caption: Mauro Icardi (Inter) finds himself beyond the last defender, but the game is stopped by the referee after the linesman signals for offside.
49:06 Caption: That's it for today, Luca Banti has blown his whistle and the game is over.
49:59 Caption: We were witnesses to an uneventful game without many stirring moments. There is definitely room for improvement in future games. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. Long balls and crosses were the main weapons of the home team. The away team tried to find the weakness in the opposition's defence especially with rapid counter-attacks.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
On a brisk evening at the San Siro stadium, an electric atmosphere hung in the air as the iconic rivals, Inter Milan and AC Milan, came face-to-face for another thrilling edition of the Milan Derby. With both sets of fans in full voice, the stage was set for an exciting showdown between these historic clubs. The initial kickoff was taken by Inter, marking the beginning of a tense clash filled with moments of brilliance, near-misses, and resolute defending.

From the very start, Inter aimed to assert their dominance, but their early aggression led to a foul just a minute into the game. This early physicality set the tone for what was to come - a feisty, hard-fought derby with both teams unwilling to give each other an inch. At the 7th minute, following a series of quick exchanges and another ball going out of play, Inter earned the first corner of the match. Hernanes delivered it to the heart of the box, but AC Milan's defense managed to clear it away without much trouble.

Inter continued to press forward, earning another corner in the 9th minute. This time, Hernanes's precise pass found an Inter player whose shot was on target, forcing AC Milan's goalkeeper Diego Lopez into a comfortable save. Hernanes was involved in much of Inter's creative play. In the 12th minute, Mateo Kovacic tried his luck from distance, but his effort sailed over the crossbar, reminding everyone of the nerves and the weight of this encounter.

AC Milan finally began to find their rhythm halfway through the first half. Jeremy Menez saw an opportunity to carve open Inter's defense in the 13th minute, although his attempt to feed an unmarked teammate was thwarted by Inter's disciplined backline. This sequence was reflective of AC Milan's strategy: intercepting and countering quickly whenever they reclaimed possession.

The first real threat from AC Milan came in the 17th minute. Suso fired a shot towards goal from the edge of the box, but Inter’s goalkeeper Samir Handanovic was equal to the task, making a solid save and denying the opposition. AC Milan continued to press, and just minutes later, another attempt from Suso was deflected away. Throughout this period, AC Milan began to dominate possession and looked increasingly menacing.

The midfield battle was fierce, with players from both sides engaged in determined tackles and strategic fouls to break up play. Inter's Rodrigo Palacio found himself penalized for aggressive play, reflecting the competitive edge both teams maintained. By the 26th minute, the tensions culminated in a yellow card for Inter's Gary Medel after a robust tackle. This incident highlighted the high stakes, with neither side willing to back down.

AC Milan soon found themselves on the receiving end of the official’s ire, too. Nigel De Jong was shown a yellow card for a heavy tackle in the 32nd minute. Defensive discipline and tactical fouling became a common theme as the match progressed, preventing clear goal-scoring opportunities from materializing. Despite the frequent interruptions, AC Milan crafted a golden opportunity when Jeremy Menez intercepted a pass and darted towards the goal, but his final ball was neutralized by Handanovic's vigilant goalkeeping.

By the end of the first half, the referee had brandished several yellow cards – each a testament to the physical, no-holds-barred nature of derby day in Milan. Players retreated to the locker rooms with the scoreline still goalless, their efforts yet to yield a breakthrough.

As the second half commenced, AC Milan kicked things off, eager to seize control. Giacomo Bonaventura almost sent his side in front within the opening moments, but his shot went narrowly wide of the right post. Inter's resolve in defense continued to frustrate Milan's attempts as the game developed into a tactical stalemate, with both sides vying for control in the midfield and finding few opportunities to break the deadlock.

With the match poised at a knife-edge, minor events punctuated the ebb and flow of the contest. There were frequent throw-ins, clearances, and interceptions as both teams battled for territorial advantage. Individual moments of skill, such as Rodrigo Palacio's solo run stymied by AC Milan's defense, showcased the attacking prowess waiting to be unleashed.

In the 18th minute of the second half, a spell of sustained Inter pressure led to several corners, fired in by Hernanes, whose deliveries troubled the AC Milan defenders. Despite excellent service from the corners, Inter couldn't capitalize, with headers and follow-ups either going wide or being blocked. The flurry of activity served as a reminder of Inter's offensive capabilities, even if they struggled to find the back of the net.

The hour mark saw Inter make a tactical substitution. Assane Gnoukouri was replaced by Joel Obi, as Roberto Mancini sought to inject fresh energy into his midfield. Soon after, another substitution followed for AC Milan, with Alex making way for Gabriel Paletta due to an injury. The changes reflected both coaches’ desires to find the right combination to tip the balance in their favor.

In the 22nd minute of the half, a beautifully taken shot by Rodrigo Palacio forced a superb save from Diego Lopez, once more denying Inter a lead. AC Milan reacted by making another offensive change, replacing Suso with Mattia Destro. The game remained finely balanced with notable tackles, timely interceptions, and clearances thwarting building momentum on both sides.

Inter's next big moment came in the 32nd minute when Xherdan Shaqiri replaced Mateo Kovacic. Just seconds later, a fierce shot from Mauro Icardi was blocked by an AC Milan defender and soon after, Shaqiri's corner was expertly handled by Lopez. Inter's frustrations continued mounting as Diego Lopez thwarted attempt after attempt, asserting his presence in the goal mouth.

As the game entered its final stages, the tempo hardly waned. A hard challenge by Inter's Danilo D'Ambrosio led to another yellow card, reasserting the match’s aggressive undertone. Further fouls and tactical interruptions disrupted play frequently, each team trying to squeeze out any remaining advantage.

In the dying minutes of the match, AC Milan almost snatched a dramatic victory when Mattia Destro unleashed a fierce strike from just outside the box. Handanovic responded with a reflexive save, showcasing his shot-stopping ability to the fullest. Inter then had another heart-pounding opportunity as Mauro Icardi’s close-range effort sailed just wide, narrowly missing the target.

Ultimately, the match concluded with a scoreline of nil-nil, both teams showing grit but lacking the finishing touch to break through. From start to finish, the derby had been a showcase of tactical awareness, defensive solidity, and strategic fouling, which contained the attacking threats and kept goalkeepers busy without enabling a decisive breakthrough.

The final whistle brought an end to a hard-fought match that, despite the lack of goals, provided plenty of thrilling moments and demonstrated the intense rivalry between Inter and AC Milan. The crowd's collective sigh at the close signified both relief and the promise of future clashes with similarly fierce competition. Though it ended goalless, the game undoubtedly delivered on the raw passion and tactical chess that characterizes the Milan Derby.
